subject: Mental Health
title: Epigenetics and Trauma
description: A quick, practical guide to Epigenetics and Trauma.

hook.text: Your grandparent's worst day may have left chemical marks on your DNA.

buildup.text: Epigenetics studies how experiences add chemical tags to genes without changing the code.

discovery.text: Trauma can add methyl groups to stress genes, altering how they function.

twist.text: These tags can be passed to children and even grandchildren.

climax.text: Mouse studies confirm that fear conditioning in parents affects offspring behavior.

punchline.text: The code stays the same. The instructions change.

quiz.question: What do epigenetic tags do to genes?
options: Alter how genes function without changing the code
Have no effect on gene expression
